p: The chilled BAADER meat, sourced from four production batches (weight of each batch: 6 kg) was transported to the Department of Biotechnology, Microbiology and Food Evaluation of the Warsaw University of Life Sciences (WULS–SGGW) under refrigerated conditions. Oregano ( Origanum vulgare L.) was added to the BAADER meat in dried form (“Kamis ®”, McCormic, Stefanowo, Poland) and as a water extract, ethanol extract, and essential oil (prepared by the authors themselves) under laboratory conditions. These are subsequently referred to as oregano preparations.
